glsa.title: RAR, UnRAR: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: RAR and UnRAR contain a buffer overflow allowing the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: RAR and UnRAR provide command line interfaces for compressing and decompressing RAR files.

description.p: RAR and UnRAR contain a boundary error when processing password-protected archives that could result in a stack-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted password-protected archive and execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user uncompressing the archive.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
